title: Dataset Description
description: This is the schema for the dataset_description.json metadata file from the Clinical Dataset Structure (CDS)

identifierValue.description: Unique string that identifies the dataset.

identifierType.description: The type of identifier used to identify the dataset.

Title.description: The main title of the dataset is mandatory. Others are optional

Version.description: The version number of the dataset. Suggested practice: major_version.minor_version. Register a new identifier for a major version change.

AlternateIdentifier.description: An identifier other than the primary Identifier applied to the resource being registered. This may be any alphanumeric string which is unique within its domain of issue. May be used for local identifiers. The AlternateIdentifier should be an additional identifier for the same instance of the resource (i.e., same location, same file).

alternateIdentifierValue.description: An identifier other than the primary Identifier applied to the dataset. This may be any alphanumeric string which is unique within its domain of issue. May be used for local identifiers.

alternateIdentifierType.description: The type of identifier used to identify the dataset.

items.description: A researcher involved in producing the data.

creatorName.description: The full name of the creator. Should be in the format: `family name, given name`. If the creator is an organization, the name should be in the format: `Organization name`.

nameIdentifierValue.description: Uniquely identifies an individual or legal entity, according to various schemes.

nameIdentifierScheme.description: The name of the name identifier scheme.

schemeURI.description: The URI of the name identifier scheme.

affiliation.description: The organizational or institutional affiliation of the creator.

affiliationName.description: Name of the organizational or institutional affiliation of the creator. In the case of an organizational creator, e.g., a research group, this will often be the name of the institution to which that organization belongs.

affiliationIdentifier.description: Uniquely identifies the organizational affiliation of the creator.

affiliationIdentifierScheme.description: The name of the name identifier scheme.

SchemeURI.description: The URI of the name identifier scheme.

Creator.description: The main researchers involved in producing the data, in priority order. To supply multiple creators, repeat this property.

contributorType.description: The type of contributor of the resource

contributorName.description: The full name of the contributor. Should be in the format: `family name, given name`. If the creator is an organization, the name should be in the format: `Organization name`.

nameIdentifierValue.description: Uniquely identifies an individual or legal entity, according to various schemes.

nameIdentifierScheme.description: The name of the name identifier scheme.

schemeURI.description: The URI of the name identifier scheme.

affiliation.description: The organizational or institutional affiliation of the contributor.

affiliationName.description: Name of the organizational or institutional affiliation of the contributor. In the case of an organizational contributor, e.g., a research group, this will often be the name of the institution to which that organization belongs.

affiliationIdentifier.description: Uniquely identifies the organizational affiliation of the contributor.

affiliationIdentifierScheme.description: The name of the name identifier scheme.

SchemeURI.description: The URI of the name identifier scheme.

Contributor.description: The institution or person responsible for collecting, managing, distributing, or otherwise contributing to the development of the dataset. To supply multiple contributors, repeat this property.

PublicationYear.description: The year in which the dataset was published.

Date.description: Different dates relevant to the dataset

dateValue.description: YYYY, YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD or any other format or level of granularity described in W3CDTF22. Use RKMS-ISO860123 standard for depicting date ranges.

oneOf.description: The date that the publisher accepted the resource into their system.
The date the resource is made publicly available. May be a range.
The specific, documented date at which the resource receives a copyrighted status, if applicable.
The date or date range in which the resource content was collected.
The date the resource itself was put together; this could refer to a timeframe in ancient history, a date range, or a single date for a final component, e.g., the finalised file with all the data.
The date that the resource is published or distributed, e.g., to a data centre
The date the creator submits the resource to the publisher. This could be different from Accepted if the publisher then applies a selection process.
The date of the last update to the resource, when the resource is being added to. May be a range.
The date or date range during which the dataset or resource is accurate.
The date the resource is removed.
The date the resource is made available under controlled access of some form. May be a range. To indicate the end of such a period, use Available.
Date type not defined elsewhere.

dateInformation.description: Additional information about the date, if needed

ResourceType.description: Description of the type of dataset

resourceTypeValue.description: Free text. The recommended content is a single term of some detail about the domain or content of the dataset so that a pair can be formed with the resourceTypeGeneral subproperty (set to `Dataset`). For example, a resourceType of `Diabetes` yields `Diabetes dataset`

resourceTypeGeneral.description: The general type of a resource.

DatasetDeIdentLevel.description: For dataset objects only, indicates the level of de-identification applied to the dataset

deIdentType.description: Provide an indication of the level of deidentification of the dataset

oneOf.description: No clear information available about the de-identification, if any, applied to the data.
Confirmed that no de-identification measures have been applied to the data set.
Some de-identification measures have been applied. Details should be described in comments and / or indicated in the linked boolean fields, or in separate documents.
Some de-identification measures have been applied and are described. In addition the data has been re-analysed against the primary outcomes and the results described.

deIdentDirect.description: If direct Identifiers were removed from the data set

deIdentHIPAA.description: If the US HIPAA de-identification rules have been applied

deIdentDates.description: If dates have been rebased and/or replaced by integers

deIdentNonarr.description: If narrative text fields have been removed

deIdentDetails.description: Provides further details of the de-identification of the dataset, perhaps referring to other documents and/or a URL.

DatasetConsent.description: For dataset objects only, provides an indication of the level of explicit consent for secondary use of the data

consentType.description: One of the allowed types, from the dataset_consent_types enumeration, e.g. `No explicit consent`, or `General research use`

oneOf.description: No clear information available about consent for secondary use, or if any exists.
No specific consent was given for the sharing of data or its re-use beyond the study in which it was originally collected.
No explicit restriction in the consent documents, though a broad consent to re-use is assumed, or this category is meaningless.
Consent indicates that use is allowed for general research use for any research purpose.
Consent indicates that use is allowed for health/medical/biomedical purposes; does not include the study of population origins or ancestry, or the development of methods / algorithms (e.g. for ML)

Consent indicates that use, for health / medical / biomedical research is allowed provided it is related to a specified disease (area). The disease (area) must be named or coded in the associated comments field.
A descriptive statement regarding consent is available, but it does not fit into categories 1 - 5

consentNoncommercial.description: If the consent allows only non-commercial use of the data

consentGeogRestrict.description: If the consent allows only use of the data in a specific geographic location

consentResearchType.description: If the consent allows only use of the data for a specific type of research

consentGeneticOnly.description: If the consent allows only use of the data for genetic research

consentNoMethods.description: If the consent allows only use of the data for research that does not involve the development of methods or algorithms

consentsDetails.description: Provides further details of the consent for secondary use associated with the dataset, if available, and in particular any details associated with the specific restrictions listed above.

Description.description: All additional information that does not fit in any of the other categories. May be used for technical information.

descriptionValue.description: A description associated with the dataset

oneOf.description: A brief description of the  resource and the context in  which the resource was created
The methodology employed  for the study or research.
Detailed information that may be associated with design, implementation, operation, use, and/or maintenance of a process or system.
Other description information that does not fit into an existing category.

Language.description: The primary language used in the dataset. Allowed values are taken from  IETF BCP 47, ISO 639-1 language codes

RelatedIdentifier.description: Identifiers of related resources. These must be globally unique identifiers.

relatedIdentifierValue.description: Identifier of the related resource. Must be globally unique.

relationType.description: The type of relationship between the dataset and the RelatedIdentifier.

relatedMetadataScheme.description: The name of the scheme. Use only with this relation pair: (HasMetadata/ IsMetadataFor)

schemeURI.description: The URI of the relatedMetadataScheme. Use only with this relation pair: (HasMetadata/ IsMetadataFor)

schemeType.description: The type of the relatedMetadataScheme, linked with the schemeURI. Use only with this relation pair: (HasMetadata/ IsMetadataFor)

resourceTypeGeneral.description: The general type of the related resource.

subjectValue.description: The subject, keyword, classification code, or key phrase that describes the dataset

subjectScheme.description: The name of the subject scheme or classification code or authority if one is used (e.g., name of ontology)
examples: Logical Observation Identifier Names and Codes (LOINC)

schemeURI.description: The URI of the subject identifier scheme

valueURI.description: The URI of the subject term

classificationCode.description: The classification code used for the subject term in the subject scheme

name.description: The name of the organization managing the dataset, in particular that determines access to it

rorId.description: The id of the organisation, if known, within the ROR (Research Organisation Registry) system. This is a URL linking to the ROR resource.

AccessType.description: The type of access to the dataset

oneOf.description: Completely open access on the web but content not available in any other format.
Completely open access, material viewable and also directly available as a file download.
Completely open access, material viewable and also available through an API.
Public and downloadable (only) once the user identifies and/or describes themselves.
Public and viewable (only) once the user identifies and/or describes themselves.
The user is an authenticated member of a defined group and can download the material (includes pay-walled journal articles).
The user is an authenticated member of a defined group but can only view the material. Analysis tools may be available.
Based on a review of an individual request, often also requiring supporting documentation.
Based on a review of an individual request, often also requiring supporting documentation. Analysis tools may be available.
The site asserts that the resource is not publicly available but provides no further details.
None of the listed options.
Dummy value supplied by default on entity creation.

AccessDetails.description: Further details of the access (especially if non public)

description.description: A textual description of the access being offered, for example identifying the groups to which access is granted, the criteria on which a case-by-case decision would be based, any further restrictions on on-screen access, etc.

url.description: A url of a web page that provides details of the access available, possibly including the practical details required or a form to use to apply for access

urlLastChecked.description: If a check has been carried out, the date the url last responded with a 200 (success) message, as a string

Rights.description: The rights associated with the dataset

rightsValue.description: Use the complete title of a license and include version information if applicable

rightsIdentifier.description: The identifier of the rights statement. A list of identifiers for commonly-used licenses may be found here: (https://spdx.org/licenses/)

rightsIdentifierScheme.description: The name of the rights identifier scheme or authority if one is used

Publisher.description: The name of the entity that holds, archives, publishes prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces the dataset. This property will be used to formulate the citation, so consider the prominence of the role.

Size.description: Size (e.g., bytes, pages, inches, etc.) relevant for the dataset

FundingReference.description: Information about financial support (funding) for the dataset

funderName.description: The name of the entity that provided the funding

funderIdentifierValue.description: Uniquely identifies a funding entity, according to various types.

funderIdentifierType.description: The type of funder identifier used.

SchemeURI.description: The URI of the funder identifier scheme or authority if one is used

awardNumberValue.description: The code assigned by the funder to a sponsored award

awardURI.description: The URI leading to a page provided by the funder for more information about the award (grant).

RelatedItem.description: Information about a resource related to the dataset, e.g., a journal or book of which the article or chapter is part. Can be used to provide series information or a text citation where the related resource does not have an identifier. However, it is also optional to provide an identifier here.

relatedItemType.description: The type of the related item, e.g., journal article; book or chapter

relationType.description: The type of relationship between the dataset and the RelatedItem.

creator.description: The institution or person responsible for creating the related resource

creatorName.description: The full name of the creator. Should be in the format: `family name, given name`. If the creator is an organization, the name should be in the format: `Organization name`.

title.description: The main title of the item is mandatory. Others are optional

publicationYear.description: The year when the item was or will be made publicly available

volume.description: The volume of the related item.

issue.description: Issue number or name of the related item

numberValue.description: Number of the related item, e.g., report number of article number

numberType.description: Type of the related item's number, e.g., report number or article number

firstPage.description: First page of the related item, e.g., of the chapter, article, or conference paper in proceedings

lastPage.description: Last page of the related item, e.g., of the chapter, article, or conference paper in proceedings

publisher.description: The name of the entity that holds, archives, publishes prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces the resource.

edition.description: The edition of the related item, e.g., the edition of a book

contributor.description: The institution or person responsible for contributing to the related resource

contributorType.description: The type of contributor of the resource

contributorName.description: The full name of the contributor. Should be in the format: `family name, given name`. If the contributor is an organization, the name should be in the format: `Organization name`.

oneOf.description: Archival Resource Key: a URI designed to support long-term access to information objects. In general, ARK syntax is of the form (brackets, []. indicate optional elements): [http://NMA/]ark:/NAAN/Name [Qualifier]]

arXiv identifier: arXiv.org is a repository of preprints of scientific papers in the fields of mathematics, physics, astronomy, computer science, quantitative biology, statistics, and quantitative finance.

Astrophysics Data System bibliographic codes: a standardized 19-character identifier according to the syntax yyyyjjjjjvvvvmppppa. See http://info-uri.info/registry/OAIHandler?verb=GetRecord&metadataPrefix=reg&identifier=info:bibcode/
Digital Object Identifier: a character string used to uniquely identify an object. A DOI name is divided into two parts, a prefix and a suffix, separated by a slash.

European Article Number, now renamed International Article Number, but retaining the original acronym, is a 13-digit barcoding standard that is a superset of the original 12-digit Universal Product Code (UPC) system
Electronic International Standard Serial Number: ISSN used to identify periodicals in electronic form (eISSN or e ISSN).
This refers specifically to an ID in the Handle system operated by the Corporation for National Research Initiatives (CNRI)
International Geo Sample Number: a 9-digit alphanumeric code that uniquely identifies samples from our natural environment and related sampling features.
International Standard Book Number: a unique numeric book identifier. There are 2 formats: a 10-digit ISBN format and a 13- digit ISBN.
International Standard Serial Number: a unique 8-digit number used to identify a print or electronic periodical publication.
International Standard Text Code: a unique `number` assigned to a textual work. An ISTC consists of 16 numbers and/or letters.
The linking ISSN or ISSN-L enables collocation or linking among different media versions of a continuing resource.
Life Science Identifiers: a unique identifier for data in the Life Science domain. Format: urn:lsid:authority:namespace:identifier:revision
PubMed Identifier: a unique identifier assigned to each PubMed record.
Persistent Uniform Resource Locator. A PURL has three parts: (1) a protocol, (2) a resolver address, and (3) a name.
Universal Product Code is a barcode symbology used for tracking trade items in stores. Its most common form, the UPC-A, consists of 12 numerical digits.
Uniform Resource Locator, also known as web address, is a specific character string that constitutes a reference to a resource. The syntax is: scheme://domain:port/path?qu ery_string#fragment_id

Uniform Resource Name: a unique and persistent identifier of an electronic document. The syntax is: urn:< NID>:<NSS> The leading urn: sequence is case-insensitive, <NID> is the namespace identifier, <NSS> is the namespace-specific string.
Permanent identifier for Web applications. Mostly used to publish vocabularies and ontologies. The letters `w3` stand for `World Wide Web`.
None of the listed identifier types.

titleValue.description: The name by which the dataset is known.

titleType.description: Empty if titleValue is the main tile. Must be from the controlled values of titleType otherwise.

oneOf.description: A subtitle provided by object creators or study sponsors.
Used in conjunction with language code to indicate language translated into.
Any alternative title not described elsewhere.
Personal name
Organizational name
Person with knowledge of how to access, troubleshoot, or otherwise field issues related to the resource
Person/institution responsible for finding or gathering/collecting data under the guidelines of the author(s) or Principal Investigator (PI)
Person tasked with reviewing, enhancing, cleaning, or standardizing metadata and the associated data submitted for storage, use, and maintenance within a data centre or repository
Person (or organisation with a staff of data managers, such as a data centre) responsible for maintaining the finished resource
Institution tasked with responsibility to generate/disseminate copies of the resource in either electronic or print form
A person who oversees the details related to the publication format of the resource
Typically, the organisation allowing the resource to be available on the internet through the provision of its hardware/software/operating support
Typically, a person or organisation responsible for the artistry and form of a media product
Person officially designated as head of project team or sub-project team instrumental in the work necessary to development of the resource
Person officially designated as manager of a project. Project may consist of one or many project teams and sub-teams.
Person on the membership list of a designated project/project team
Institution/organisation officially appointed by a Registration Authority to handle specific tasks within a defined area of responsibility
A standards-setting body from which Registration Agencies obtain official recognition and guidance
A person without a specifically defined role in the development of the resource, but who is someone the author wishes to recognize

A person involved in analysing data or the results of an experiment or formal study. May indicate an intern or assistant to one of the authors who helped with research but who was not so `key” as `o be listed as an author.
Typically refers to a group of individuals with a lab, department, or division that has a specifically defined focus of activity.
Person or institution owning or managing property rights, including intellectual property rights over the resource
Person or organisation that issued a contract or under the auspices of which a work has been written, printed, published, developed, etc.
Designated administrator over one or more groups/teams working to produce a resource, or over one or more steps of a development process
A Work Package is a recognized data product, not all of which is included in publication. The package, instead, may include notes, discarded documents, etc. The Work Package Leader is

Any person or institution making a significant contribution to the development and/or maintenance of the resource, but whose contribution is not adequately described by any of the other values for contributorType

The individual who, if not the sponsor themselves, leads and co-ordinates the scientific and clinical activity within a clinical study, including co-ordinating the work of principal investigators at clinical sites. May be known as the Co-ordinating Investigator, the Study Chair, Study Director or similar terms.
The individual responsible for the safe conduct of a clinical trial at a particular clinical site.
An individual responsible for the operational management of a clinical study. Similar to a Project Manager but a study manager is heavily involved in the management of data and data collection.
The organisation or individual that has the formal, legal role of a clinical trial sponsor, and is legally responsible for all aspects of a clinical trial.
An individual representing the sponsor and acting as an initial contact point.
An individual designated as dealing with non-scientific queries from the public or press.
An individual designated as providing periodic updates on recruitment information or status, at all sites, usually for monitoring purposes.
An organisation providing some or all of the additional funds required for the study.
An individual representing the funder and acting as an initial contact point.
A member of a safety monitoring committee for a clinical trial, independent of the researchers and research activity.
Organisation that provides one or more of the medicines investigated in a clinical study.
Organisation that provides one or more of the medical devices in a clinical study.
Organisation that provides logistical input, e.g. provides a drug distribution service.
Organisation that provides scientific support, e.g. a national or international research network.
Organisation that provides a central specialist laboratory testing facility..
Organisation that provides a central specialist imaging or scanning facility.
Organisation, usually a primary or secondary health care organisation, that manages one or more of the sites where a clinical study takes place.
Organisation or location, usually in a primary or secondary health care organisation, that is one of the sites where a clinical study takes place.
May be listed as a secondary sponsor, an organisation other than the lead sponsor involved in supporting a study.
An individual with the role of sponsor as well as being the co-ordinating investigator for the study.
The individual, occasionally organisation, to be contacted for further information on the study results.

From PubMed, an 'investigator' is an individual (e.g., collaborator or investigator) who is not an author of a paper but is listed as a member of a collective/corporate group that is an author of the paper.
A series of visual representations imparting an impression of motion when shown in succession. May or may not include sound.
A medium for recording information in the form of writing or images, typically composed of many pages bound together and protected by a cover
One of the main divisions of a book.
An aggregation of resources, which may encompass collections of one resourceType as well as those of mixed types. A collection is described as a group; its parts may also be separately described.
A virtual notebook environment used for literate programming
Article that is written with the goal of being accepted to a conference
Collection of  academic papers  published in the  context of an  academic conference
A factual and objective publication with a focused intent to identify and describe specific data, sets of data, or data collections to facilitate discoverability
Data encoded in a defined structure
A written essay,  treatise, or thesis, especially one written by a candidate for the degree of Doctor of Philosophy
A non-persistent, time-based occurrence
A visual representation other than text
A resource requiring interaction from the user to be understood, executed, or experienced
A scholarly  publication consisting of articles that is  published regularly throughout the year.
A written composition on a topic of interest, which forms a separate part of a journal.
An abstract, conceptual, graphical, mathematical or visualization model that represents empirical objects, phenomena, or physical processes
A formal document that outlines how  research outputs are to be handled both during a research  project and after the project is completed
Evaluation of  scientific, academic, or professional work by others working in the same field
An inanimate, three dimensional object or substance
A version of a  scholarly or scientific paper that precedes formal peer review and publication in a peer-reviewed scholarly or scientific journal
A document that presents information in an organized  format for a specific audience and purpose
An organized system of apparatus, appliances, staff, etc., for supplying some function(s) required by end users

A computer program other than a computational notebook, in either source code (text) or compiled form. Use this type for general software components supporting scholarly research. Use the “ComputationalNoteb ook” value for virtual notebooks.
A resource primarily intended to be heard
Something  established by  authority, custom, or general consent as a model, example, or point of reference
A resource consisting primarily of words for reading that is not covered by any other textual resource type in this list
A structured series of steps which can be executed to produce a final outcome, allowing users a means to specify and enact their work in a more reproducible manner
If selected, supply a value for ResourceType.

relationType.description: Description of the relationship of the dataset (A) and the related resource (B).

oneOf.description: indicates that B includes A in a citation
indicates that A includes B in a citation
indicates that A is a supplement to B
indicates that B is a supplement to A
indicates A is continued by the work B
indicates A is a continuation of the work B
indicates A describes B
indicates A is described by B
indicates resource A has additional metadata B
indicates additional metadata A for a resource B
indicates A has a version (B)
indicates A is a version of B
indicates A is a new edition of B, where the new edition has been modified or updated
indicates A is a previous edition of B
indicates A is a portion of B; may be used for elements of a series
indicates A includes the part B
indicates A is published inside B, but is independent of other things published inside of B
indicates A is used as a source of information by B
indicates B is used as a source of information for A
indicates B is documentation about/ explaining A; e.g. points to software documentation
indicates A is documentation about B; e.g. points to software documentation
indicates B is used to compile or create A
indicates B is the result of a compile or creation event using  A
indicates A is a variant or different form of B
indicates A is the original form of B
indicates that A is identical to B, for use when there is a need to register two separate instances of the same resource
indicates that A is reviewed by B
indicates that A is a review of B
indicates B is a source upon which A is based
indicates A is a source upon which B is based
Indicates A is required by B
Indicates A requires B
Indicates A replaces B
Indicates A is replaced by B
